summary: Build a decentralized web game on Internet Computer named "Spacecoco": a fast, absurd, addictive multiplayer (up to 8 players) Snake-style game with multi-input controls, ICP wallet-based cosmetic skins, dynamic planet modifiers, bosses, power-ups, and an on-chain leaderboard — now targeting a high-quality retro-cartoon neon visual style (very bright, “expensive” look) with an animated, highly dynamic start/menu presentation (UFOs/aliens/vacas with lasers), upgraded modern arcade-neon scoring UI, improved competitive mechanics (head/body elimination with score drop pickup), and upgraded SFX/audio polish using web-feasible rendering/audio techniques (no Vulkan/true RT/HDR10).
architectural_notes: Project pivot: replace used-items marketplace with a Snake-style multiplayer web game on Internet Computer called "Spacecoco".
Multiplayer target: up to 8 players with real-time state synchronization.
Use ICP wallet integration for cosmetic skin selection/switching.
User-approved scope change: replace (not just add) existing sprite/visual assets with a new arcade pixel-art style (neon snake, UFO/cow, starfield, VFX).
User-approved scope change: replace existing music direction/system content with more modern, high-energy tracks ("GTA V" vibe).
Gameplay tweak requested: snake should always be in motion; growth primarily from eating UFOs; cows/penguins provide bonus points; add animated crocodile entities.

New art direction request: move from arcade pixel-art replacement to a higher-detail retro-cartoon neon look (very bright/‘expensive’) using web-feasible rendering (WebGL/WebGPU postprocessing; no Vulkan/true ray tracing/HDR10).
New UX request: highly animated splash/home/menu presentation with UFOs/aliens and cows firing lasers for an immediate ‘wow’ effect.
New gameplay request: competitive elimination—body hits opponent head => opponent resets to normal size; winner can collect dropped points to grow/score.
known_issues: Production build (Version 4) shows a blank screen: game does not render anything and there is no movement.

existing_features.title: Create the product’s overall visual theme and apply it consistently across the UI for the “Gatos Use Items” used-items marketplace. Theme must be a coherent, distinct style (colors, typography, spacing, components) suitable for a trusted second-hand marketplace, and must avoid default/generic styling.
Implement Internet Identity sign-in and session-aware navigation so users can create and manage their own used-item listings.
Build the core marketplace pages: Home/Landing, Browse Listings, Listing Details, Create Listing (“Sell”), and My Listings, wired to backend APIs using React Query.
Support listing images via user-provided image URLs (no file uploads), including multi-image previews and safe validation.
Generate and include basic brand/marketing static images for the app, and render them in the UI from frontend static assets (not through the backend).

Rebrand the existing app as “Spacecoco” and replace the marketplace navigation/pages with a game-focused UI that includes: a Home screen, a Lobby/Matchmaking screen, the in-game Play screen, a Skins screen, and a Leaderboard screen. All user-facing text must be in English.

Implement the core Spacecoco Snake-style gameplay loop on the Play screen with fast, responsive movement, scoring, rounds, and lose/win conditions. The game must support level progression and include: rotating planet modifiers (Mars craters slow movement; Titan fog reduces visibility; Europa slippery ice), variable gravity (low/high effects on movement), obstacles (UFOs dropping flying cows), and randomized power-up spawns.

Add cross-platform controls for steering the snake: mobile swipe gestures, keyboard (arrow keys and WASD), and optional mouse-follow steering. Provide an in-game control hint overlay that adapts to the current input method (English text).
Implement multiplayer matches for up to 8 players, including a lobby/matchmaking flow, match creation/joining, and synchronized gameplay state suitable for the Internet Computer environment.

Add boss encounters: spawn a penguin boss every five levels; players must circle the boss three times to win/advance. Add the “Supreme Cow” unlock at 1000 points: a silent floating boss with red eyes that launches UFOs and exploding cow missiles, causes map shake, and makes everything extremely slippery.

Add a cosmetic skin system with 10 selectable snake skins: Reticulated Python, King Cobra, Black Mamba, Anaconda, Rattlesnake, Krait, Taipan, Boa Constrictor, Gaboon Viper, and Feathered Quetzalcoatl. Players can change their active skin using their ICP wallet (on-chain action), and the selected skin persists per user.

Implement an on-chain leaderboard that records high scores and exposes read APIs for global top scores and a player’s personal best. The frontend Leaderboard screen must display the global leaderboard and the current user’s best score.

Add an in-game audio system with chiptune-style space music: a base track that gradually intensifies when the player is close to losing, planet-specific remixes for Mars/Titan/Europa, silence before the Supreme Cow encounter, and an epic chord sting when it begins. Provide basic audio settings (mute/volume) in the UI.
Generate and include the required Spacecoco static art assets (sprites/illustrations) under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI/game (no backend image serving).

Render a black starfield background with randomly placed stars on the Play screen canvas as an additive visual layer (do not change the existing Spacecoco theme). The starfield should be subtly animated (e.g., gentle drift or twinkle) while keeping gameplay visuals readable.
Update game initialization so the snake spawns centered on the grid with green color and an initial length of 5 blocks, while keeping the rest of the existing game theme and mechanics intact.

Adjust obstacle spawning rules so that every 2 seconds a UFO descends from the top of the playfield carrying a cow inside, as an additive behavior (do not remove existing obstacle/power-up systems; integrate with them).

Ensure the penguin boss spawn rule is enforced: every 5 levels, spawn a penguin boss in the center of the playfield (additive confirmation/adjustment that must not break other boss logic, including existing circling mechanics).

At the start of each match, play a short looping chiptune background track at low volume. This must be additive: it must not remove or disable any existing dynamic/intensifying music behavior (if present); it should coexist or transition without regressing existing audio features.

Replace the current in-canvas Spacecoco visuals with an arcade pixel-art style and use sprite-based rendering for core entities (snake, UFO, cow, penguin boss, crocodile, laser VFX, and pixel explosion VFX) while keeping the existing starfield background.
Generate and add the required pixel-art sprite assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and update the game renderer to load and draw them.
Replace the current chiptune/oscillator background music with a more modern, high-energy, action-focused original soundtrack and integrate it with the existing Play screen mute control.

Implement the updated core gameplay rules: the snake is always moving; the snake grows more when eating UFOs; cows and penguins grant bonus points; game over occurs when the snake head hits the border or its own body.
Add animated, fun crocodile entities to the game as additional moving targets/obstacles consistent with an “eat and grow” famous-game feel, including clear scoring behavior when collected/defeated.
Add sound effects for (1) firing the red laser (“pew”) and (2) eating a cow (“muuuuh”), and trigger them during the corresponding gameplay events.
Keep all user-facing UI text in English while updating any in-game instruction text that no longer matches the new rules (UFO-driven growth and bonus points from cows/penguins/crocodiles).

Fix the Play screen blank/no-render issue by ensuring the requestAnimationFrame game loop actually starts after sprites finish loading (avoid stale React hook closures). In particular, `startGame()` and `resumeGame()` must invoke a `gameLoop` function that sees the latest `spritesLoaded` value and does not early-return incorrectly.

Add a robust runtime fallback so the Play screen is never fully blank if sprite loading fails: surface a user-visible error overlay with an actionable message and ensure at least a minimal canvas render (e.g., clear + starfield) still occurs even when `loadAllSprites()` rejects.

Verify and correct the runtime sprite asset paths used by the sprite loader so they resolve in production (IC canister hosting) and allow `spritesLoaded` to become true when the assets exist under `frontend/public/assets/generated`.

Upgrade the Spacecoco start experience (Home screen + Lobby screen) to a high-motion, retro-cartoon neon presentation: add an animated hero/splash scene with UFOs/aliens flying across the screen and bright cows firing eye-lasers, while keeping the game name and core navigation intact.

Revamp the in-game scoring UI (HUD) to a modern arcade retro-neon style with large digits, bright neon color accents (purple/red/blue/green as primary palette), and high-clarity readability over gameplay.

Implement an updated competitive scoring model that awards points when the snake eats objects and when it successfully eliminates an opponent, with on-screen score feedback (e.g., floating neon number popups) that clearly communicates how many points were gained.

Add the competitive elimination rule: when a snake hits an opponent's head with its body, the opponent resets back to the normal starting size, and the winner can collect dropped point items to gain score and grow.

Increase perceived visual quality during gameplay using web-feasible rendering techniques without changing the core rules: add a brighter, more 'expensive' neon look via post-processing-like effects (e.g., glow/bloom styling, laser trails, subtle motion blur/trailing) while preserving gameplay readability and performance.

Upgrade audio polish using web-feasible techniques: replace or improve SFX to higher-quality versions and add stronger gameplay feedback (e.g., stereo/spatial feel, filters/ducking where appropriate), while keeping mute behavior working on the Play screen.

Generate and include new high-quality retro-cartoon neon static art assets and sprite sheets needed for the updated start/menu presentation and brighter in-game VFX, placed under frontend/public/assets/generated and loaded directly by the frontend (no backend image serving).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create the core "Spacecoco" Snake-style web gameplay loop with fast, responsive movement, scoring, rounds, and win/lose conditions.
Support multiplayer matches for up to 8 players (real-time), including lobby/matchmaking and synchronization suitable for Internet Computer.
Implement simple cross-platform controls: mobile swipe, PC arrow keys/WASD, and optional mouse-follow steering.

Add 10 selectable snake skins (reticulated python, king cobra, black mamba, anaconda, rattlesnake, krait, taipan, boa constrictor, Gaboon viper, feathered Quetzalcoatl) and allow switching skins using an ICP wallet.
Add rotating alien planet round modifiers: Mars (craters slow movement), Titan (fog reduces visibility), Europa (slippery ice), plus variable gravity effects (low/high).
Add obstacles and power-ups: UFOs that drop flying cows; eating a cow enables colored lasers (red burn, blue freeze, green poison).
Add boss encounters: penguin bosses every five levels; players must circle the boss three times to win/advance.
Add dynamic chiptune audio system: space background music that intensifies near losing, planet-specific remixes, silence before the "Supreme Cow", then an epic chord.
Add "Supreme Cow" unlock at 1000 points: floating silent boss with red eyes that launches UFOs and exploding cow missiles, causes map shake and extreme slipperiness.
Implement decentralization elements: on-chain leaderboard and randomized power-up distribution.

Extend the backend canister to support Spacecoco game state and multiplayer synchronization: create/join/leave lobbies, start matches, accept player input updates, advance authoritative game ticks, and provide read APIs for current match state. Use canister-based randomness for power-up distribution.
Add a black starfield background with randomly placed stars (preferably subtle animation) without changing the existing Spacecoco theme.
Set the initial snake spawn to start centered on the screen, green color, with initial length of 5 blocks.
Adjust obstacle spawning so a UFO descends from the top every 2 seconds carrying a cow inside (additive change).
Ensure a penguin boss appears in the center every 5 levels (additive rule/confirmation).
At the start of a match, play a short looping chiptune background track at low volume (without removing existing dynamic/intensifying music behavior).

Replace existing Spacecoco in-game visuals with an arcade pixel-art style: neon-green 20px grid snake with black outline, head eyes + tongue animation, metallic gray UFO with red lights, flying cow sprite, pixel explosions, red laser VFX, and black starfield with twinkling white stars.
Replace the existing music/audio direction with more modern, action-focused, 'GTA V'-like music (overall replacement rather than additive tracks).

Adjust core gameplay rules: snake is always moving; grows more when eating UFOs; cows and penguins grant extra points (growth behavior clarified as UFO-driven); keep classic game-over on hitting body or border unless otherwise overridden.
Add animated, fun crocodile entities as additional targets/obstacles consistent with 'eat and grow' famous game feel (including point behavior to be defined).
Upgrade visuals to a high-quality retro-cartoon neon style (bright, cool, ‘expensive’ look) using web-feasible postprocessing (e.g., bloom/motion blur/trails) while keeping the core game intact.
Create an animated, highly dynamic splash/home/menu presentation: aliens/UFOs flying across the screen, bright cows firing eye-lasers, lots of motion and ‘wow’ factor.
Revamp the scoring/points system to be modern and entertaining: award points for eating objects and for eliminating opponents; add clear neon number popups/animations that match gameplay mechanics.

Add competitive elimination rule: if a snake hits an opponent’s head with its body, the opponent resets to normal starting size while dropping points/collectibles that the winner can eat to gain points and grow.
Improve SFX/audio polish with higher-quality sounds and stronger gameplay feedback (e.g., spatialization/filters where feasible in web) to increase clarity and addictiveness.
